document.docTitle: A new species of the genus Macronychus Müller, 1806 from China (Coleoptera, Elmidae)

subSection.paragraph:
4
�
maoshuwuyouzhi@163.com; https://orcid.org/ 0000-0002-5339-853X

* Corresponding author:
� chenxs3218@163.com; https://orcid.org/0000-0001-9801-0343

Macronychus xuhaoi
sp. nov.
, a new species of the genus
Macronychus Müller, 1806
is described from Xizang , Southwest China . The new species belongs to
Macrynychus quadriluberculatus
species group. Habitus and other diagnostic features of the new species are described and illustrated.

Key words:
Elmidae
,
Macronychus
,
new species
,
Xizang
,
China

The elmid genus
Macronychus Müller, 1806
was described by Müller (1806) based on
M. quadrirubercularus
from Germany . After that, several species were described between 1824–1980, but not all of them were placed in correct genera. Members of this genus occur in the Palearctic, Nearctic and Oriental region (Jäch et 2016). Čiampor & Kodada (1998) revised the genus
Macronychus
, described new species, new synonyms and provided a key. Moreover, three species-groups were proposed to contain 12 known species.

Thus far, there were four
Macronychus species
recorded from China , collected during a series of cooperative efforts focused on Chinese water beetles:
M. reticulatus Čiampor & Kodada, 1998
from Hunan ;
M. jaechi Čiampor & Kodada, 1998
from Hainan ;
M. kubani Čiampor & Kodada, 1998
from Yunnan and Sichuan and
M. jendeki Čiampor & Kodada, 1998
from Anhui , Hunan and Jiangxi ( Jäch & Boukal 1995 , Čiampor & Kodada 1998 ).

The biology and larval stage of
Macronychus
are poorly known, except the west Palearctic
M. quadrituberculatus
and the Nearctic
M. glabratus Say, 1825
( Contarini 1832 , Dufour 1862 , Perez 1863 , Le Sage & Harper 1976a , b, 1977). Larvae and adults of
M. quadrituberculatus
are usually found on submerged water-logged wood in unpolluted larger streams and rivers. Previous laboratory observations have revealed that those two species are unusually longevous:
M. glabratus
survived in an aerated aquarium more than 10 years, and
M. quadrituberculatus
5 years ( Brown 1973 , Čiampor & Kodada 1998 ).

In this paper, we report a new
Macronychus species
from China ( Xizang ), based on series of specimens collected by light trap. Diagnosis, description, and illustrations of the new species are provided herein.
Examined material is deposited in the Institute of Entomology, Guizhou University, Guiyang, China (GUGC) and the Insect Collection of Mianyang Normal University, Mianyang, China (MYNU, Dr. Hao Xu).

Collecting data of the specimens are quoted verbatim. The Chinese translation of each locality below provincial level is included in parentheses at the first appearance in the text. Each type specimen bears the following label: “ HOLOTYPE (red) (or PARATYPE (yellow)), ♂ (or ♀ ),
Macronychus xuhaoi
sp. n. , Jiang & Chen, 2023.”.

Habitus images were taken using a Canon 5D SR camera in conjunction with a Mitutoyo Plan NIR 5 lens. Images of the morphological details were taken using a Canon 5D SR camera in conjunction with a Mitutoyo Plan NIR 10 lens or a Nikon SMZ25 stereoscopic microscope with a Nikon DS-Ri2 camera. Zerene Stacker (version 1.04) was used for image stacking. All images were finalised and grouped into plates in Adobe Photoshop CS5 Extended.

The following abbreviations are applied: HL—length of head from the anterior clypeal margin to the occipital constriction; HW—width of head across eyes; PL—length of pronotum along midline; PW—maximum width of pronotum; EL—length of elytra along suture; EW—maximum width of elytra; CL—length of the sum of PL + EL.

Description. Male ( Figs 1A , 2 , 3A–D , 4A–E ). Body moderately elongate ( Fig. 1A ), black, legs and antennae dark brown, anterior margin of pronotum reddish brown. Dorsal surface shiny, covered with sparse short setae.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1. Dorsal habitus of
Macronychus xuhaoi
sp. nov. A.
Male; B. Female.

subSection.paragraph: Aedeagus ( Figs 4 A–D ), slender, elongate, nearly symmetrical, slightly subpically constricted in lateral view; apex almost rounded, median lobe with four sclerotizations, a pair of smaller, located near base, and two larger ones, located at 1/3 of the median lobe, surface with short hair-like setae along apical 1/2; spiculum gastrale as in Fig. 4E . Sternite VIII ( Fig. 4F ) with deeply emarginate apical margin.

Female ( Figs 1B , 3E , 4G–I ): externally similar to male, usually larger, protarsal segments ( Fig. 3E ) lacking tuft of long setae at ventral surface. Apical margin of sternite VIII ( Fig. 4G ) weakly rounded. Ovipositor as in Fig. 4H , long and slender; stylus ( Fig. 4I ) weakly curved, apex with several small sensilla; coxite ( Fig. 4I ) with apex distinctly roundly broadened at outer margin, without sensilla; valvifer long, about twice as long as coxite, fibula with basal 1/3 distinctly expanded, finely curved at apical 1/3.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 2. Diagnostic features of
Macronychus xuhaoi
sp. nov.
, male. A. Head, dorsal view; B. Antenna; C. Pronotum, dorsal view; D. Prosternal process. Note: red arrow, scutellum.

subSection.paragraph: Distribution. China : Only known from type locality: Motuo County, Linzhi City, Xizang Province .
Etymology. The species is named in honor of Dr. Hao Xu (Mianyang Normal University, Sichuan , China ), who collected the new species and donated it to us for this study.

Comparative diagnosis.
Macronychus xuhaoi
sp. nov.
could be placed in the
Macrynychus quadriluberculatus
species group based on the following characters: 1) median keel of pronotum flat with sides slightly declivous; 2) surface of metasternum covered with sparse macropunctures, each puncture bearing a long seta; 3) carinae of ventrite I not reaching posterior margin of ventrite; 4) femora moderately enlarged, not clavate.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 3. Diagnostic features of
Macronychus xuhaoi
sp. nov.
, A–D, male; E, female. A. Metaventrite; B. Abdomen; C. Elytra; D–E. Protarsus. Note: red arrows in A: impressions of metaventrite; in B: carinae of ventrite I; in D: setal tufts of protarsus.

subSection.paragraph:
The new species is similar to
Macronychus reticulatus
Čiampor & Kodada 1998
in habitus character, like the moderately elongated body and legs.
M. xuhaoi
sp. nov. can be distinguished from the latter species by the following characters:1) body larger,> 2.5 mm ; 2) femora slender and weakly clavated; 3) pronotum widest at basal 1/4 (vs. widest at basal 1/3); 4) median lobe of aedeagus not narrowed between base to middle in lateral view, with two pairs of sclerotizations (vs. median lob of aedeagus distinctly narrowed at basal 1/4, with one pair of sclerotizations located at base); 5) spiculum gastrale with base extended (vs. short and not extended at base); 6) apex of preterminal segment of ovipositor not bilobate.

Macronychus xuhaoi
sp. nov.
is also more or less similar to
M. vietnamensis Delève, 1968
and
M. levanidovae Say, 1825
, which are included in
M. glabratus
species group. The new species can be distinguished from them by the following characters: 1) head and tibiae without plastron setae; 2) median lobe of aedeagus with two pairs sclerotizations (vs. with three).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 5. A. The location of light trap in type locality of
Macronychus xuhaoi
sp. nov.
; B. Water environment near the location of light trap. (both were taken by Dr. Hao Xu).

subSection.paragraph: We would like to express our sincere gratitude to Drs Hao Xu and Jian-Yue Qiu (Mianyang Normal University, Mianyang, China ) for provide specimens of this study, Dr. Hao Xu also provide us habitat pitures, and to Dr. Ji- Shen Wang (Dali University, Kunming, China ) for his support. Two anonymous reviewers critically reviewed the manuscript are highly appreciated. Financial support was provided by the Program of Excellent Innovation Talents, Guizhou Province (No. 20154021).
